message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV. 

The paper describes a neuromorphic chip architecture for pattern recognition using spiking neurons and memristive synapses. This falls under the category of neural networks and machine learning, which is covered by cs.NE. The use of memristive synapses also suggests a focus on hardware implementation, which is covered by cs.ET (emerging technologies). The paper also discusses competitive learning, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the demonstration of handwritten digit recognition suggests a focus on computer vision (cs.CV).
